briefdescription.para: Check if the Notecard response contains an error.

parameterdescription.para: The response to check.

simplesect.para: true if there's an error and false if there's not.

briefdescription.para: Free a response from the Notecard.

parameterdescription.para: The response to free.

briefdescription.para: The default I2C address of the Notecard.
The maximum number of bytes to request from or transmit to the Notecard in a single chunk.
The floating point type used for JSON handling in note-c.
The signed integer type used for JSON handling in note-c.
The unsigned integer type used for JSON handling in note-c.
The type for the millisecond delay hook.

parameterdescription.para: The number of milliseconds to delay for.

briefdescription.para: The type for the memory freeing hook.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the memory to free.

briefdescription.para: The type for the millisecond counter hook.

simplesect.para: The value of the millisecond counter.

briefdescription.para: The type for the debug output hook.

parameterdescription.para: The debug text to output.

simplesect.para: Number of characters written, or 0 on failure.

briefdescription.para: The type for the I2C receive hook.

detaileddescription.para: This hook is used to receive a buffer of bytes from the Notecard.

parameterdescription.para: The I2C address of the Notecard sending the data to receive.
A buffer to hold the data received from the Notecard.
The size, in bytes, of rxBuf.
The number of bytes remaining to be received, if any.

simplesect.para: NULL on success and an error string on failure.

briefdescription.para: The type for the I2C reset hook.

detaileddescription.para: This hook is used to reset the I2C peripheral used to communicate with the Notecard.

parameterdescription.para: The I2C address of the Notecard.

briefdescription.para: The type for the I2C transmit hook.

detaileddescription.para: This hook is used to send a buffer of bytes to the Notecard.

parameterdescription.para: The I2C address of the Notecard to transmit the data to.
A buffer of bytes to transmit to the Notecard.
The size, in bytes, of txBuf.

simplesect.para: NULL on success and an error string on failure.

briefdescription.para: The type for the memory allocation hook.

parameterdescription.para: The number of bytes to allocate.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the newly allocated memory or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: The type for the various mutex (i.e. lock/unlock) hooks.
The type for the serial available hook.

simplesect.para: true if there's data to read and false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: The type for the serial receive hook.

simplesect.para: The received byte.

briefdescription.para: The type for the serial reset hook.

detaileddescription.para: This hook is used to reset the serial peripheral used to communicate with the Notecard.

simplesect.para: true on success and false on failure.

briefdescription.para: The type for the serial transmit hook.

parameterdescription.para: A buffer of bytes to transmit to the Notecard.
The size, in bytes, of txBuf.
If true, flush the serial peripheral's transmit buffer.

briefdescription.para: The type for the transaction start hook.

parameterdescription.para: Transaction timeout in milliseconds.

simplesect.para: true if the transaction was started successfully, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: The type for the transaction stop hook.
Reset the Notecard, clearing any error state.

detaileddescription.para:
true if the reset was successful, false otherwise.
Reset the Notecard, clearing any error state.

simplesect.para: True if the reset was successful and false if not.

briefdescription.para: Mark that a Notecard reset is required on the next transaction.

detaileddescription.para: This function sets an internal flag indicating that the Notecard should be reset before the next communication attempt.
Mark that a Notecard reset is required on the next transaction.

briefdescription.para: Create a new request JSON object.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a dynamically allocated J object with one field "req" whose value is the passed in request string.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the Notecard API request (e.g., "card.version").

simplesect.para: A pointer to a newly allocated JSON object with the "req" field populated, or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Create a new command JSON object.

detaileddescription.para: Create a dynamically allocated J object with one field "cmd" whose value is the passed in request string. Commands are similar to requests, but the Notecard does not send a response.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the Notecard API command (e.g., "card.restart").

simplesect.para: A pointer to a newly allocated JSON object with the "cmd" field populated, or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Send a request to the Notecard and return the response.

detaileddescription.para: The passed in request object is always freed, regardless of if the request was successful or not.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a J request object.

simplesect.para: A J object with the response or NULL if there was an error sending the request.
NoteResponseError to check the response for errors.

briefdescription.para: Send a request to the Notecard, retrying until it succeeds or times out, then return the response.

detaileddescription.para: The passed in request object is always freed, regardless of if the request was successful or not.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a J request object.
Time limit for retries, in seconds.

simplesect.para: A J object with the response or NULL if there was an error sending the request.
Timeouts may occur when either there is no response, or if the response contains an I/O error.
NoteResponseError to check the response for errors.

briefdescription.para: Send a request to the Notecard and return the response as JSON string.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike NoteRequestResponse, this function expects the request to be a valid JSON C-string, rather than a J object. The string is expected to be newline-terminated, otherwise the call produces undefined behavior. The response is returned as a dynamically allocated JSON C-string. The response is newline-terminated, just like the request. The caller is responsible for freeing the response string. If the request was a command (i.e. it uses "cmd" instead of "req"), this function returns NULL, since commands do not have a response.

parameterdescription.para: A valid newline-terminated JSON C-string containing the request.

simplesect.para: A newline-terminated JSON C-string with the response, or NULL if there was no response or if there was an error.
When a "cmd" is sent, it is not possible to determine if an error occurred.

Unlike the NoteRequest* functions, this function does not automatically free the request JSON string. It is not possible to know if the parameter is a string literal. As such, it is the caller's responsibility to manage the memory associated with the request string.

briefdescription.para: Suppress showing transaction details.
Resume showing transaction details.
Enable debug output for sync status monitoring.

parameterdescription.para: How often to poll for sync status, in milliseconds.
Maximum detail level for sync status output.

simplesect.para: true if debugging was enabled successfully, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Send a request to the Notecard.

detaileddescription.para: The passed in request object is always freed, regardless of if the request was successful or not. The response from the Notecard, if any, is freed and not returned to the caller.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a J request object.

simplesect.para: true if successful and false if an error occurs (e.g. out of memory or the response from the Notecard has an "err" field). If req is a command rather than a request, a true return value indicates that the command was sent without error. However, since the Notecard sends no response to commands, it does not guarantee that the command was received and processed by the Notecard.
NoteRequestResponse if you need to work with the response.

briefdescription.para: Send a request to the Notecard, retrying until it succeeds or times out.

detaileddescription.para: The passed in request object is always freed, regardless of if the request was successful or not. The response from the Notecard, if any, is freed and not returned to the caller.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a J request object.
Time limit for retries, in seconds, if there is no response, or if the response contains an I/O error.

simplesect.para: true if successful and false if an error occurs (e.g. out of memory or the response from the Notecard has an "err" field).
NoteRequestResponseWithRetry if you need to work with the response.

briefdescription.para: Set the request timeout for Notecard transactions.

detaileddescription.para: Provides control for transactions which must be tailored based upon the nature of the transaction being performed.

parameterdescription.para: The timeout in seconds (0 for default).

simplesect.para: The previous timeout value that was overridden.

briefdescription.para: Send a request to the Notecard and return the response.

detaileddescription.para: This function doesn't free the passed in request object. The caller is responsible for freeing it.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a J request object.

simplesect.para: A J object with the response or NULL if there was an error sending the request.
NoteResponseError to check the response for errors.

briefdescription.para: Check if an error string contains a specific error type.

parameterdescription.para: The error string to check.
The error type to search for in errstr.

simplesect.para: true if the error string contains the specified error type, false otherwise.
Only Notecard errors enclosed in {} (e.g. {io} for an I/O error) are guaranteed by the API.

briefdescription.para: Clean up an error string by removing all bracketed tags.

detaileddescription.para: Notecard errors are enclosed in {} (e.g. {io} for an I/O error). This function takes the input string and removes all bracketed errors from it, meaning it removes any substrings matching the pattern {some error string}, including the braces.

parameterdescription.para: A C-string to to clean of errors.

briefdescription.para: Set the debug output function hook.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the debug output function.

simplesect.para: This operation will lock Notecard access while in progress, if Notecard mutex functions have been set.

briefdescription.para: Get the currently set debug output function hook.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store the current debug output function pointer.

briefdescription.para: Set the transaction hook functions.

parameterdescription.para: Function to call when starting a transaction.
Function to call when stopping a transaction.

simplesect.para: This operation will lock Notecard access while in progress, if Notecard mutex functions have been set.

briefdescription.para: Get the platform-specific transaction hook functions.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store the current transaction start function.
Pointer to store the current transaction stop function.

simplesect.para: Any of the passed in pointers can be NULL if the caller is not interested in that particular function pointer.

memberdef.argsstring: (mutexFn lockI2Cfn, mutexFn unlockI2Cfn, mutexFn lockNotefn, mutexFn unlockNotefn)
memberdef.name: NoteSetFnMutex

Function to unlock I2C access.
Function to lock Notecard access.
Function to unlock Notecard access.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store the current I2C lock function.
Pointer to store the current I2C unlock function.
Pointer to store the current Note lock function.
Pointer to store the current Note unlock function.

simplesect.para: Any of the passed in pointers can be NULL if the caller is not interested in that particular function pointer.

briefdescription.para: Set the I2C mutex functions.

parameterdescription.para: Function to lock I2C access.
Function to unlock I2C access.

briefdescription.para: Get the currently set I2C mutex functions.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store the current I2C lock function.
Pointer to store the current I2C unlock function.

simplesect.para: Any of the passed in pointers can be NULL if the caller is not interested in that particular function pointer.

briefdescription.para: Set the Notecard mutex functions.

parameterdescription.para: Function to lock Notecard access.
Function to unlock Notecard access.

briefdescription.para: Get the currently set Notecard mutex functions.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store the current Notecard lock function.
Pointer to store the current Notecard unlock function.

simplesect.para: Any of the passed in pointers can be NULL if the caller is not interested in that particular function pointer.

memberdef.argsstring: (mallocFn mallocfn, freeFn freefn, delayMsFn delayfn, getMsFn millisfn)
memberdef.name: NoteSetFnDefault

briefdescription.para: Set the default system functions (memory allocation, delay, timing).

parameterdescription.para: The platform-specific function for memory allocation.
The platform-specific function for memory deallocation.
The platform-specific function for millisecond delays.
The platform-specific function to get millisecond counter.

simplesect.para: These functions are used if no other system functions are set.
This operation will lock Notecard access while in progress, if Notecard mutex functions have been set.

memberdef.name: NoteSetFn

briefdescription.para: Set the system hook functions (memory allocation, delay, timing).

parameterdescription.para: The platform-specific function for memory allocation.
The platform-specific function for memory deallocation.
The platform-specific function for millisecond delays.
The platform-specific function to get millisecond counter.

simplesect.para: This function overrides any previously set system functions.
This operation will lock Notecard access while in progress, if Notecard mutex functions have been set.

briefdescription.para: Get the platform-specific memory and timing hook functions.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store the current memory allocation function.
Pointer to store the current memory deallocation function.
Pointer to store the current delay function.
Pointer to store the current millisecond counter function.

simplesect.para: Any of the passed in pointers can be NULL if the caller is not interested in that particular function pointer.

memberdef.name: NoteSetFnSerial

The platform-specific function to check if serial data is available.
The platform-specific function to receive serial data.

This operation will set the active interface to serial.
This operation will lock Notecard access while in progress, if Notecard mutex functions have been set.

briefdescription.para: Set the default serial communication hook functions.

The active interface (NOTE_C_INTERFACE_SERIAL, NOTE_C_INTERFACE_I2C, or NOTE_C_INTERFACE_NONE).

The active interface. One of:
NOTE_C_INTERFACE_NONE (default)
NOTE_C_INTERFACE_SERIAL
NOTE_C_INTERFACE_I2C

briefdescription.para: Disable all Notecard communication functions.

Variable arguments for the format string.

The debug message to output.

The debug message to output.

See the NOTE_C_LOG_LEVEL_* macros for possible values.

The log level to set:
NOTE_C_LOG_LEVEL_ERROR
NOTE_C_LOG_LEVEL_WARN
NOTE_C_LOG_LEVEL_INFO

detaileddescription.para:
Current millisecond counter value.
Get the current millisecond counter value.

simplesect.para: The current milliseconds value.

briefdescription.para: Use platform hook to delay for the specified number of milliseconds.

parameterdescription.para: Number of milliseconds to delay.

briefdescription.para: Lock I2C access for thread safety.

detaileddescription.para: Lock I2C access for thread safety.

briefdescription.para: Unlock I2C access.

detaileddescription.para: Unlock I2C access.

briefdescription.para: Get the current I2C address being used for Notecard communication.

detaileddescription.para:
The I2C address of the Notecard.
If the address remains unset or is set to 0x00 using NoteSetI2CAddress, the address will be returned as NOTE_I2C_ADDRESS_DEFAULT.
NoteGetI2CAddress
Get the current I2C address being used for Notecard communication.

simplesect.para: The current I2C address.

briefdescription.para: Get the current MTU for I2C communication with the Notecard.

detaileddescription.para: The MTU is the maximum number of bytes that can be sent to or received from the Notecard in a single I2C transaction.

Maximum number of bytes that can be transferred in a single I2C transaction.
If the MTU remains unset or is set to 0 using NoteSetI2CMtu, the MTU will be returned as NOTE_I2C_MTU_DEFAULT.
The MTU value returned will always be less than or equal to NOTE_I2C_MTU_MAX. If a value larger than NOTE_I2C_MTU_MAX was set using NoteSetI2CMtu, the MTU will be silently reduced to NOTE_I2C_MTU_MAX.
NoteGetI2CMtu
Get the current MTU for I2C communication with the Notecard.

simplesect.para: A 32-bit integer of the maximum number of bytes per I2C segment.

briefdescription.para: Get the amount of available memory.

simplesect.para: Amount of available memory in bytes, or 0 if unknown.

briefdescription.para: Print text using the configured debug output function.

parameterdescription.para: The text to print.

simplesect.para: true if the text was printed successfully, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Print a line of text followed by a newline.

parameterdescription.para: The line of text to print.

briefdescription.para: Print formatted text using printf-style formatting.

parameterdescription.para: The printf-style format string.
Variable arguments for the format string.

simplesect.para: true if the text was printed successfully, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Safe string copy function.

detaileddescription.para: Copies up to siz-1 characters from src to dst, ensuring dst is always null-terminated.

parameterdescription.para: Destination buffer.
Source string.
Size of destination buffer.

simplesect.para: Length of src string.

briefdescription.para: Safe string concatenation function.

detaileddescription.para: Appends src to dst, ensuring the result is null-terminated and does not exceed siz characters total.

parameterdescription.para: Destination buffer containing existing string.
Source string to append.
Total size of destination buffer.

simplesect.para: Total length of the string that would result from the concatenation.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the JSON subsystem.
Check the JSON subsystem for memory leaks or other issues.
Check if a field is present in a JSON object.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to check.
The field name to look for.

simplesect.para: true if the field is present, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get a string value from a JSON object field.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to query.
The field name to retrieve.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the string value, or an empty string ("") if the field doesn't exist or isn't a string.
The returned string is a pointer to the string contained in the JSON object. It is not a copy of the string, so once the JSON object is freed, the pointer is no longer valid.

briefdescription.para: Get the number field from a JSON object.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to query.
The field name to retrieve.

simplesect.para: The numeric value, or 0.0f if the field doesn't exist or isn't a number.
The returned value is the floating point representation of the number.

briefdescription.para: Get an array object from a JSON object field.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to query.
The field name to retrieve.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the JSON array (J *), or NULL if the field doesn't exist or isn't an array.
The returned JSON object is a pointer to the array contained in the parent JSON object. It is not a copy, so once the parent JSON object is freed, the pointer is no longer valid.

briefdescription.para: Get a JSON object from a JSON object field.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to query.
The field name to retrieve.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the nested JSON object, or NULL if the field doesn't exist or isn't an object.
The returned JSON object is a pointer to the object contained in the parent JSON object. It is not a copy, so once the parent JSON object is freed, the pointer is no longer valid.

briefdescription.para: Get the integer value of a number field from a JSON object.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to query.
The field name to retrieve.

simplesect.para: The integer value, or 0 if the field doesn't exist or isn't a number.
The returned value is the integer representation of the number.

briefdescription.para: Get the value of a boolean field from a JSON object.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to query.
The field name to retrieve.

simplesect.para: The boolean value, or false if the field doesn't exist or isn't a boolean.

briefdescription.para: Get the numeric value from a JSON item.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON item to query.

simplesect.para: The numeric value, or 0.0f if the item isn't a number.

briefdescription.para: Get the string value from a JSON item.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON item to query.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the string value, or empty string if the item isn't a string.

briefdescription.para: Get the boolean value from a JSON item.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON item to query.

simplesect.para: The boolean value, or false if the item isn't a boolean.

briefdescription.para: Get the integer value from a JSON item.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON item to query.

simplesect.para: The integer value, or 0 if the item isn't an integer.

briefdescription.para: Check if a JSON object field is NULL or an empty string.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to query.
The field name to check.

simplesect.para: true if the field is null, missing, or an empty string; false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if a JSON object field exactly matches a test string.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to query.
The field name to check.
The string to compare against.

simplesect.para: true if the field value exactly matches teststr, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if a JSON object field contains a substring.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to query.
The field name to check.
The substring to search for.

simplesect.para: true if the field exists and contains the substring, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (J *json, const char *fieldName, const void *binaryData, uint32_t binaryDataLen)
memberdef.name: JAddBinaryToObject

briefdescription.para: Add binary data to a JSON object as a base64-encoded string.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to modify.
The field name to add.
A buffer of binary data to encode.
The length of the binary data in bytes.

simplesect.para: True if the string was successfully encoded and added to the object, otherwise false.

briefdescription.para: Decode a Base64-encoded string field in a JSON object and return the decoded bytes.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to query.
The field name to retrieve.
A pointer to a pointer used to store the decoded binary data (caller must free).
A pointer to an unsigned integer used to store the length of the decoded binary data.

simplesect.para: true if the binary data was successfully decoded, false otherwise.
The returned binary buffer must be freed by the user with JFree when it is no longer needed.
On error, the returned binary buffer and data length shall be set to NULL and zero (0), respectively.

briefdescription.para: Get the name/key of a JSON item.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON item to query.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the item's name/key, or the empty string, if the item has no name.

briefdescription.para: Allocate a new JSON string and copy contents of the buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer containing the string data.
The length of buffer in bytes.

simplesect.para: If buffer is NULL or length 0, the empty string. If allocation fails, NULL. On success, the converted c-string. The returned string must be freed with JFree.

briefdescription.para: Get a string representation of a JSON item's type.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON item to query.

simplesect.para: String representation of the item's type (e.g., "number", "string", "object").

briefdescription.para: Get the type of a field, as an int usable in a switch statement.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON object to query.
The field name to check.

simplesect.para: Type code (JTYPE_* constants), or JTYPE_NOT_PRESENT if the field doesn't exist.

briefdescription.para: Get the type code of a JSON item.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON item to query.

simplesect.para: Type code (JTYPE_* constants).

briefdescription.para: Get the base type from a detailed type code.

parameterdescription.para: The detailed type code to convert.

simplesect.para: The base type code.

briefdescription.para: Convert a number to a string.

parameterdescription.para: The number to convert.
Buffer to store the string result.
Number of decimal places for floating point numbers.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the string representation.

briefdescription.para: Convert a string to a number.

parameterdescription.para: The string to convert.
Pointer to store the position where conversion stopped (optional).

simplesect.para: The numeric value.

briefdescription.para: Convert an integer to a string.

parameterdescription.para: The integer to convert.
Buffer to store the NULL-terminated string result.

simplesect.para: The buffer must be large enough because no bounds checking is performed.

briefdescription.para: Convert a string to an integer.

parameterdescription.para: A null-terminated text buffer.

simplesect.para: The integer value (0 if invalid)

briefdescription.para: Calculate the length needed for base64 encoding.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the data to be encoded.

simplesect.para: Length of the base64-encoded string (including null terminator).

briefdescription.para: Encode data to base64.

parameterdescription.para: Buffer to store the base64-encoded result.
Source data to encode.
Length of the source data.

simplesect.para: Length of the encoded string.

briefdescription.para: Calculate the length of data after base64 decoding.

parameterdescription.para: The base64-encoded string.

simplesect.para: Length of the decoded data.

briefdescription.para: Decode base64 data.

parameterdescription.para: Buffer to store the decoded result.
The base64-encoded string to decode.

simplesect.para: Length of the decoded data.

The MD5 context to finalize.

Length of the data in bytes.

briefdescription.para: Convert an MD5 hash to a hex string.

Buffer to store the hex string representation.

briefdescription.para: Configure the flow control for the auxiliary serial port.

The time to wait between reads.

briefdescription.para: Reset the binary store.

briefdescription.para: Set the session time in seconds.

memberdef.name: NoteLocalTimeST

briefdescription.para: Get the local time in a structured format (session time).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store the year.
Pointer to store the month (1-12).
Pointer to store the day (1-31).
Pointer to store the hour (0-23).
Pointer to store the minute (0-59).
Pointer to store the second (0-59).
Pointer to store the weekday name.
Pointer to store the timezone name.

simplesect.para: true if the time was successfully retrieved, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the current region/timezone information.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store the country name.
Pointer to store the area/city name.
Pointer to store the timezone name.
Pointer to store the timezone offset in minutes from UTC.

simplesect.para: true if the region information was successfully retrieved, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if the Notecard's location is valid.

briefdescription.para: Check if the Notecard's session-time location is valid.

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable turbo I/O mode (deprecated).

parameterdescription.para: True to enable turbo mode, false to disable.

xrefdescription.para: This function is deprecated and should not be used.

briefdescription.para: Get an integer environment variable from the Notecard.

Default value to return if the variable doesn't exist.

simplesect.para: The integer value of the environment variable, or defaultVal if not found.

briefdescription.para: Get a numeric environment variable from the Notecard.

Default value to return if the variable doesn't exist.

Default value to use if the variable doesn't exist.

simplesect.para: true if the variable was successfully retrieved, false otherwise.

Size of the mode buffer.

simplesect.para: true if the location mode was successfully set, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Send a body to a route using an HTTP request.

detaileddescription.para: Body is freed, regardless of success.

The Notehub Route alias.
The Notefile name.
The request JSON body (will be consumed/freed).

simplesect.para: true if request was successful, false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: The payload descriptor to modify.
4-character segment type identifier.
Pointer to the segment data.
Length of the segment data.

simplesect.para: true if the segment was successfully added, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Find a data segment in a payload.

parameterdescription.para: The payload descriptor to search.
4-character segment type identifier to find.
Buffer to copy the segment data to.
Pointer to the length of the segment data.

memberdef.name: NotePayloadGetSegment

4-character segment type identifier to get.
Buffer to copy the segment data to.
Maximum length of data to copy.

simplesect.para: true if the segment was found and copied, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set a template for a notefile to optimize transmission.

detaileddescription.para: Templates allow the Notecard to send only changed values, reducing bandwidth usage.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the notefile to create a template for.
JSON object describing the template structure (will be consumed/freed).

simplesect.para: true if the template was successfully set, false otherwise.
